review.review_text: Great atmosphere and the food was amazing can't wait to go back and try another dish

restaurant.name: The Hat Chicago
restaurant.timings: 10:30 AM to 11 PM

review.review_text: I do want to give both the burger and the chicken sandwich a try but for now I've been settled in on the cheese fries, the hot dog and when warm outside I liked their banana shake made with fresh fruit. Come back soon Summer. The Hat Loaded Fries On my first visit the loaded fries were pretty great. Taking the flavor profile of a potato skin they enhance standard frozen fries greatly by using Merkt's cheddar spread, sour cream and bacon bits. The first time the bacon was bits of real bacon but since then they've been actual bacon bits from the package. So they went down a notch but remain tasty.

restaurant.name: Froyo Chicago
restaurant.timings: 8 AM to 6 PM (Mon-Fri),Closed (Sat-Sun)

restaurant.name: Chicago B.L.U.E.S. Bar
restaurant.timings: 8 PM to 2 AM (Mon-Sun)

restaurant.name: Chicago Distilling Company
restaurant.timings: Closed (Mon, Tue, Wed, Sun), 5 PM to 9 PM (Thu),5 PM to 11 PM (Fri-Sat)

review.review_text: Ate no food here. I don't often drink cocktails, but I was out with my family and my dad wanted to see if their whiskey had improved with aging. I had a gin and tonic with their house made gin- best one I've had ever, anywhere. The bartender came to answer our questions about drink ingredients and was cheerful, knowledgeable, and proud of her recipe. Great experience.

restaurant.name: Blue Chicago
restaurant.timings: 8 AM to 2 AM (Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sun), 8 AM to 3 AM (Sat)

review.review_text: Small Bar, Great Music  If you're looking for blues downtown, this is the place. It's always crowded and the music is always good. Usually lots of dancing as well!

Blue Chicago is a blues bar in River North that’s been providing visitors with authentic live Chicago blues music since 1985. Blue Chicago highlights a variety of artists every night of the week, with a particular focus on female vocalists.

It may not have have the legendary status of other venues, but it is THE choice for a small, intimate, genuine, blues night in Chicago. Great atmos, people with great character, excellent musicians. The walls literally tell the history of the blues, with artwork from John Carroll-Doyle. Drinks are on the cheap side, but be prepared to tip generously, NY-style, especially because the front man will repeatedly point it out throughout the night. Blues people, as in many other cases, have their own codes and expect certain reactions and engagement from the audience, and you will feel like a newbie if you're one, but don't be intimidated. Do get early in order to get a seat, and enjoy.

restaurant.name: Charlie's Chicago
restaurant.timings: 3 PM to 4 AM (Mon-Sat),3 PM to 5 AM (Sun)

restaurant.name: Chicago Philly Stop
restaurant.timings: 6:30 AM to 11 PM (Mon-Thu),6:30 AM to 12 Midnight (Fri),8 AM to 12 Midnight (Sat),9 AM to 9 PM (Sun)

restaurant.name: Dylan's Candy Bar - Chicago
restaurant.timings: 10 AM to 10 PM (Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Sun), 10 AM to 11 PM (Fri-Sat)

review.review_text: It's a fancy world. My daughter loved the place and it's preparation. Very colorful and a dream for every kid. Friendly staff. Its in downtown and a must visit place.

It is the Kingdom of Candies. Just imagine a huge shop with multi levels entirely full of all kinds of candies. Whatever you dream about you see it in front of your eyes. Jelly, hard, soft, gums, bars, pills etc... you name it. They even have chocolate !!! I was even more excited than my 4 years old little girl. Grab some nylon bags and start filling. But beware prices could hurt at the end. They even have a special dessert bar in this shop dedicated for some goodies they make in house. I must say that the candies we bought and tasted are really tasty. You find the promised flavor in every type.

I was introduced to Dylan through some Must-Eat-At-ChiTown-Lists - and just the one fact that their desserts are instagram worthy took me all the way there.   So, I ordered the Carnival Milkshake that definitely a gorgeous colouful picture. I would the milkshake rather too liquidy in consistency - more like milk. But, yeah - decent for a one time buy.  A great pesto shrimp flat bread to go with it.   Must also mention that their version of the brownie with a slight burnt flavour is delicious.   Cost : About 30USD for a person. Higher than average.   Bottomline : Their Chocolate fudge is supposed to be good - and the brownie was excellent. Great decor too - a child will be thrilled in here.

Beware of dishonest employees and uneducated cashiers.  We were visiting from out-of-state and the shop was pointed out to us by Uber driver from airport.  Bulk candy is $7.99/lb.  We selected 3 small bags of assorted bulk gummy pieces and the bill was $22. I was expecting under $10.   asked the cashier, how much did that weigh?  He was very confused an said "1 pound and 24 oz."  I said, "oh,so that weighed 2 and 1/2 pounds?"  He repeated "1lb. 24 oz."  Then he started giggling and said he didn't know.  He was very confused looking at the cash register.  I checked the receipt after we got back.  He charged us $14.99/lb. for 1.24 pounds of little chewy type candy.  Beware $20+ for a very small bag of non-premium candy.  I believe this was cashier error or complete incompetence.

Dylan's Candy Bar isn't different than the candy store at any mall across America. I was expecting to be able to find things I couldn't find anywhere else but it's your basic stuff I can get at the grocery. I also tried the iced coffee and it tasted like it was made from river water and old coffee grounds from the trash. Skip this place and head for the Walgreens down the street. You'll be happier.

restaurant.name: Max & Leo's Artisan Pizza - Chicago
restaurant.timings: 11 AM to 11 PM (Mon-Sun)

review.review_text: Amazing food!!!! The coal oven makes that food taste so juicy and with a lot a flavor if you looking for different taste of pizza you should try it !! You wouldn't be disappoint it.

The sexiest pizza and wings I've ever had. The Honey Hot Habnaro wings are incredible! Spicy and crazy good. Also my favorite Pizza is the Paradigm... Its like a Meat Lovers Pizza on tinder and you just want to swipe right evertime! Max &Leo was a perfect spot for my date before we went to the movies!

Amazing coal fire pizzas, wings, and ribs! There's one other coal fire pizza place around here and nothing compares to Max and Leo's! It's a nice date night spot if you're looking for something quiet.
The pizza is great & it's attached to kings, so I was able to bowl and play pool. I had a amazing time. The coal fired wings and ribs in ma and Leo's are amazing. My favorite appetizers.

restaurant.timings: 11 AM to 9 PM (Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Sun), 11 AM to 10 PM (Fri-Sat)

review.review_text: These are not Chicago Style Ribs.  Take the time and go to Chicago if you want some Chicago Style Ribs. I was given scraps for tips, and they were overpriced.  I was hoping that they were good because the options for ribs in this area are  limited, but I was very disappointed.  Sorry to have to give this review, but I hope this will be an eye opener for the owner. Live upto you name.

restaurant.name: The Chicago House of 'Za Vegan Pizzeria
restaurant.timings: 3 PM to 8:30 PM (Wed-Thu), 2 PM to 9 PM (Fri), 12 Noon to 9 PM (Sat), 12 Noon to 5 PM (Sun), Mon & Tue Closed

restaurant.name: Chicago Cut Steakhouse
restaurant.timings: 7 AM to 2 AM (Mon-Fri),10 AM to 1:30 AM (Sat-Sun)

photo.caption: Mixed greens salad and filet mignon
Chocolate ganache raspberry marscipone layer cake
Chicago Cut Steakhouse sea bass - Chilean Sea Bass

review.review_text: Credit to a Toyota billboard, seen along the highway to O'Hare airport, for today's post title, and because in real life, this filet mignon with shrimp from Chicago Cut Steakhouse was much tastier than I can make it look or sound on this blog:. Also, I almost forgot to take a photo of it, and it's already half gone...
Decent food but flat beer and crappy service. Staff laughs at customers from afar, unmotivated staff until they want a tip. At that point the pleasantries begin l. I will not go back.

The service is top notch, the food is amazing! Yes it is pricey but you get what you pay for with this place. The wait staff the hostess the bar tender and the managers were all so amazing. The view from the dinning room is spectacular. Amazing experience.

Disappointed and disgusted! Service like I have never experienced before! I made my reservations a month in advance, I received my email confirmation, I then called back two weeks later (2 weeks before my reservation) to add 3 more guest, also received that confirmation. Everything seemed to be great and dandy...until I got there. Hostess didn't seem to want to be there, very distance, and no smile. My reservations were at 530p, I arrived at 520p. Two of my guest were around the corner at 540p when the hostess or waitress (wasn't sure who she was) came to tell me that if my guest don't arrive in the next five minutes they will have to give up my table.  First, I apologized and told her I wasn't made aware of that hard cut off time, but my guest should be arriving any minute they are waiting for valet. When they finally arrived right on target (544p), she told me that they have already given up my table! I asked to who? (people who just walk in with no reservations apparently!) I was 10 minutes early, someone could have told me when I called twice to make the reservation and second time to add additional guest. No one said anything to me when I checked in 10 minutes early and was told to wait at the bar for the rest of my guest. Nothing was sent or said in both email confirmations. Waitress didn't seem to care and instead said "thats our policy and unfortunately we don't seat incomplete tables" an shrugged her shoulders. I asked to speak to a manager. I explained to the manager the situation and the fact that nothing was said to me about a 15 minute cut off and how could they give my table away when I was already checked in and literally waiting on their slow valet service that now seemed to have cost me my table! Manager simply stated "we can have another table ready for you at our sister restaurant"  This place (which I don't even know the name of) was two blocks away! He made us walk over (and mind you, everybody in my family had heels on! We did valet for a reason! HELLO!!)  The entire walk over I felt degraded, I felt stupid, and not to mention cold!! I mean I made this reservation a month in advance and even called back to add guest AND received two confirmation emails and yet no one said anything about a hard cut off until I had 5 minutes left?! I'm sorry but that is completely and utterly unprofessional. I made the reservation for my birthday, for the experience, but I left with a bad taste in my mouth for this place. Never again Chicago Cut! AND to make matters worse, the food was terrible! Ive have better steak at Kenzie ChopHouse where the waiters and waitress actually know the types of cuts they have!!  I ordered a NY strip medium rare and the steak was so dry I needed to eat it with some type of sauce (I never eat my medium rare steak with a sauce if the juices are still there, which they should be!)  I would not recommend this place to anyone looking for a great steakhouse in Chicago. Kenzie Chophouse is much much better than this place!
Amazing food! Great staff. Fist time visiting from Australia we found the restaurant on this app and walked there from our hotel with ease. We had a lovely experience at this restaurant.

restaurant.name: Talay Chicago
restaurant.timings: 11 AM to 10 PM (Mon-Thu),11 AM to 11 PM (Fri-Sat),3 PM to 10 PM (Sun)

review.review_text: I loved this place, I don't understand why it is so empty. Ambience is great and the food was amazing!! Great prices and quality. I'll comeback for sure

Not bad. I was riding my bicycle around looking for a place to eat one day and I ran into this place. I thought, "Hmmmmm, Thai, why not?" The decor inside wasn't bad. I always end up getting some red curry chicken when I eat Thai. It wasn't bad, but I wouldn't throw this to the top of my list of best Thai restaurants. If you're hungry for Thai, and it's close, check it out.

restaurant.name: Vapiano Chicago Loop
restaurant.timings: 11am – 11pm (Mon, Tue, Wed, Sun), 11am – 12midnight (Thu-Sat)

review.review_text: The atmosphere is very laid back. The hotdogs are total chicago. I love their grilled tuna. They also have good pasta dishes. My husband says Chicago hotdogs are the best.

Vapiano has this amazing italian, I visited this place twice during my two days in Chicago, and this place gave me perfect pizza, agli olio pasta and perfect cheese cakes for my meal, they have a gud service and friendly staff.Keep it up ..Will surely visit during my next stay.

This place was terrific!! The pizza was both chewy and crispy. We enjoyed it so much we went back the next night!  Great selection of pastas and anti-pasta also. The ordering system is easy after you do it once.  The only miss is the bowl of gummy bears that everyone digs their paws in upon leaving. Gross.
This place has amazing pastas and they make it in live kitchen so you can customise your dish a bit.  The pizzas are average but the pastas are a must try.
awesome, the carbonara is very tasty, the presentation is very good and the atmosphere is fine. The price is right and the quality of meal is good.

review.review_text: It turns out they are not the same as the Wings Around the World from the down the street, but they use a lot of the same recipes.  The wings were just as good as we remember and this restaurant is a little bit better than the one down the street was.  The big difference is that they have seating and a much bigger menu, but the only thing we really cared about was the wings….and DAMN are they good.

review.review_text: Why 4? Why not 5? Let us have this settled first at $50 per head it is $$$$ in true sense. Portions are decent but not large. Variety is good, cuisine is Asian and everything we had was between excellent and good :)  Edamame 5/5Shishito Peppers 5/5Veg Egg Role 4/5Veg Dumplings 5/5Veg Chow Fun 5/5Szechuan Potatoes - Spicy, real spicy 4/5Choco Cake 5/5Drinks were all goodAmbiance - Excellent

review.review_text: Went to Kubo on a cold evening in January 2018. We were 4 of us who had never tried Filipino food. I'd recommend it as a must try, really warm staff and timely service. It's a medium sized restaurant, and I'm not positive if it can handle large groups. An impressive variety of cocktails and our host suggested a few cocktails which we really enjoyed.  Must Try: Pancit Carne Asada Pinoy Style Kaldereta Chocolate Cake A La Mode  Don't Try: Fish and Squid Balls

restaurant.name: Amorino Chicago

location.address: 838 North State Street, Gold Coast, Chicago 60610

restaurant.timings: 12 Noon to 10 PM (Mon-Thu),12 Noon to 11 PM (Fri-Sat),Closed (Sun)

review.review_text: Looking for a new ice cream spot the wife and I happened upon Amorino.  Little Love in Italian possibly?  While I'm not sure if I loved it, it was really good ice cream nonetheless.  The unique thing about Amorino that may be worth a trip is the presentation of the ice cream.  If you order a cone they will shape the scoops as if they are the pedals of a rose.  It's a pretty cool sight to see the servers in action as your order is being made.  The only other place I know similar to this is a little spot in Budapest that we were able to check out on our honeymoon.  There are quite a few choices from fruity to chocolatey. But the thing is that it takes a while for a cone to be made so you don't really get a chance to see the flavors before it's your time to order.  We were in an adventurous mood so we told the guy serving us to surprise us and it worked out really well.  I think that speaks to how you can't go wrong with flavor you choose.  The highlights were the coffee flavor and there was this one that tasted just like cheesecake filling.  I'm not sure exactly what it was called but it was delightful.  Just be careful if you're taking a picture as it melts a lot faster than you think and unless you take preventative measures the opposite side of the cone will be dripping.   One more thing, if you order the large, they give you a baby sized ice cream cone on top of your ice cream.  I have a picture of my wife holding it, as she thought it was the cutest thing she had ever seen outside of a daschund puppy.  Forgive me as I now realize this is a gelato shop and I've been calling it ice cream this whole time.

restaurant.name: Kings Chicago - Lincoln Park
restaurant.cuisines: American, Desserts, Fast Food, Pub Food
restaurant.timings: 3 PM to 11 PM (Mon-Thu), 11 AM to 11 PM (Fri-Sun)

review.review_text: Great food and service, the food surprised us considering that it is a bowling ally!  Outdoor seating is great our favorite the buffalo wong tong also not too loud! Sarah Degen

Where top quality food and bowling meet, with every menu item is a drink to be perfectly paired by the bar! Service is number one priority at this spot along with quality! If your looking for a night of fun activity such as bowling with a bar close by kings bowling is reigns over all.

Kings is a really fun place. I love the food they have because it's all from scratch! Really cool atmosphere to be in! They have a really friendly staff who's attentive and all about customer service, which is really refreshing!  I also love the live DJ they have on the weekends after 9! Super cool and always a blast to be around!   If your not in the mood for bowling, they also have a really cool artisan pizza place that's attached to the front of the building before you enter kings. Try their honey hot habanero if your a spicy lover like me!

Me and my friends came into Kings on a Wednesday where it was All you Can Bowl. It was a Great time, Amber was our server and went above and beyond for my party!!! It was my best Mate's birthday and couldn't of been happier!!!!   Also was incredibly easy on the eyes!!! #TexasBaby

Kings is a hidden gem in the LP neighborhood! Great social scene during the weekends. Saturday nights get packed! My friends and I booked an Eat then Bowl reservation and got a lane much sooner than other people walking in. The food was amazing, the drinks were delicious 😋 The Kings wings are definitely worth a try! And the big balls are perfect for couples to share 😄

restaurant.name: Fornetto Mei - Whitehall Hotel Chicago

location.address: Whitehall Hotel Chicago, 107 E Delaware Place 60611

restaurant.timings: 7 AM to 11 AM, 5 PM to 10 PM (Mon-Sun)

review.review_text: A restaurant. In a hotel. Downtown. On a Tuesday night, a night when clouds exploded to form a torrential downpour, with tornados touching down into the plains out west of Chicago.Welcome to Fornetto Mei: A Restaurant I Did Not Expect To Like, But Did, And Ended Up Enjoying It Immensely.Featuring pizza that promises a "delicious departure from Chicago's deep dish pies", Fornetto Mei sounded quasi-Asian to me upon first hearing the name but ended up being a 100% Northern Italian-style restaurant, with a dimly-lit dining room that instantly put me at ease and made me feel comfortable 30 seconds into my experience. I felt like I was in my own private sanctuary and would definitely come back to hang out and have drinks after work and munch on apps.At first, we sat in the main dining room, which seats about 25 people. Looking to my left, I noticed a luxe looking atrium cum sun room facing out onto Delaware Place about a block away from Michigan Avenue and the hubbub of the Magnificent Mile. "Can we switch tables," I asked. "Absolutely," said our outstanding server, who was perfect in every single way: he dropped everything to take our order, let me enjoy an $8 glass of wine with no up-charge (we had a Gilt voucher entitling us to a $7 glass of wine) and answered questions about the source of ingredients ("The pizza dough is homemade and the cheese comes in a plastic bag with milk in it; you can't get any fresher mozzarella than that"). He told us that his two favorite pizzas were the Calabrese and the Margherita. Sold.

Stayed at the Whitehall hotel. One night while staying in the Whitehall, we walked downstairs and into one of the best meals of our week in Chicago.  First of all. Dim Sum in an Italian place? Check out the name - Fornetto and Mei's Kitchen - WTF? We LOVE dim sum and these were good dumplings served with martinis on a Thursday night! The waiter, a casual, but consummate professional, spoke knowledgeably about the food and even offered us a half order of a few things we wanted to try. The Oxtail gnocchi was spectacular. We liked the pizza too. Nice place.  We have often stayed at the Whitehall since it has a super location in the middle of the Gold Coast and is a major bargain. Now I can say that it really does have great food. I just don't recall trying it before. BTW - The breakfast is better than average too.

Small quiet atmosphere a few steps off Michigan Avenue. Service can be spotty. The Signature Pizza makes it worth any wait. Wood-fire pizza oven. Thin crust. Goat cheese, sausage, grapes and herbs. Everytime I come to Chicago I have to be sure and come in for a beer and the pizza.
Great appetizers especially the French fries
BEST DEAL EVER, that's what I have to to say. For anyone who lives near the gold coast or is shopping along Michigan Avenue during the day, I urge you to stop by Fornetto Mei.

restaurant.name: King Crab House Chicago

location.address: 1816 North Halsted Street, IL, Lincoln Park, Chicago 60614

restaurant.timings: 4 PM to 11 PM (Mon-Thu), 11 AM to 11 PM (Fri), 10 AM to 12 Midnight (Sat), 10 AM to 10 PM (Sun)

restaurant.name: State and Lake Chicago Tavern

location.address: The Wit Hotel, 201 N State Street, Chicago 60601

restaurant.timings: 6 AM to 11 PM (Mon-Thu),6 AM to 2 AM (Fri),6:30 AM to 2 AM (Sat),6:30 AM to 10 PM (Sun)

review.review_text: I ordered the Poutine, Pimento Cheese Dip with Chips, and Soft Pretzel with Red Pepper and Goat Cheese Dip. The Poutine came with bacon and peas and was super cheesy and delicious, not weighed down in gravy like Poutine can be. The Pimento Dip was good, but far and away, the real winner was the pretzel with goat cheese and red pepper dip. It tasted like a jalapeño popper without being fried, and the pretzel was crispy on the outside and super soft on the inside.
Nice place for happy hour. $5 beers and inexpensive bites. Attentive bartenders. Right next door to the Wit so very convenient to the hotel and theatre district.

Wow what an incredible experience enjoying a famous Chicago Dog at one of the best restaurants in Chicago. It was within walking distance from our hotel and the Dog, Polish Sausage, and Italian sausage met all our expectations. Especially the Chicago Dog!

We stopped in last night after work for drinks and appetizers. I was disappointed they haven't jumped on the Happy Hour train yet and they didn't have any specials. But I really liked the cocktail I ordered, the Mistress - a cool, refreshing grapefruit flavored drink. If you like grapefruit, you'll love this cocktail. My husband got the Blueberry Vandermill Cider and got a free State/Lake coosie with each can.  For food we tried the Poutine, Pimento Cheese Dip with Chips, and Soft Pretzel with Red Pepper and Goat Cheese Dip. The Poutine came with bacon and peas and was super cheesy and delicious, not weighed down in gravy like Poutine can be. The Pimento Dip was good, but far and away, the real winner was the pretzel with goat cheese and red pepper dip. It tasted like a jalapeño popper without being fried, and the pretzel was crispy on the outside and super soft on the inside. I don't usually like goat cheese, but I loved this. And the presentation of all the dishes was creative.   The only downside was the service. Apparently we got caught in a shift change and had quite the time trying to track someone down to pay our bill (like 20+ minutes of waiting for someone give our money to). Luckily the food and drinks were on point, so this didn't sully our experience too much.

Great food and service. All of the hotel staff is great! Had breakfast with the family, his have the chicken and waffles. Lightly smoky and delicious. The bacon was smoky peppered and large, perfectly cooked.

restaurant.name: Chicago Burger Company

location.address: Fashion Outlets of Chicago, 5220 Fashion Outlets Way, Rosemont 60018

restaurant.timings: 10 AM to 9 PM (Mon-Sat),10 AM to 7 PM (Sun)

review.review_text: Situated at Fashion Outlets of Chicago this place serves good hot juicy burgers - chicken beef and salads.  Had ordered a chicken sandwich with pineapple. The bun was top notch and very soft.  The chicken patty was well roasted [for the lack of better word] and juicy. Had also taken a chicken hot dog 🌭, just like with Burger this also had a very soft bread but the overall feel and taste was very bland. Good place for a quick snack.  Cheers!!

restaurant.name: Mei's Corner - Whitehall Hotel Chicago

location.address: The White Hall Hotel, 105 E. Delaware Place, Chicago 60611

restaurant.timings: 11 AM to 10 PM (Mon-Sun)

photo.caption: Sweet n sour chicken lunch special

review.review_text: Not bad Chinese considering there is virtually none in the area. Good lunch combo specials.

Delicious. I typically avoid restaurants near/in hotels. They're often overpriced and mediocre, in my opinion. This is an exception. It's a small restaurant. Service is good and the food is outstanding. I ate here once before and enjoyed that. I don't recall what I ate, but remember it being delicious. I loved the Orange Beef this time. I would add a picture, but i ate too quickly.
Attractive little place in the Whitehall Hotel.  Great lunch combo deal.

I had a heavy negative bias going into the meal given the hotel restaurant setup but was pleasantly surprised with some of the dishes. The portions were small but the prices weren't too high. The neighborhood has much more interesting and tasty options, but for it's purpose Mei's corner served us well. I'm giving them 2.5 out of 5 Pearls.

restaurant.name: Liberty Tavern- Hilton Rosemont Chicago O'Hare

location.address: Hilton Rosemont Chicago O'Hare, 5550 North River Road, Rosemont 60016

restaurant.timings: 6 AM to 10 PM (Mon-Sun)

restaurant.name: NoMI Lounge - Park Hyatt Chicago

location.address: Park Hyatt Chicago, 800 N. Michigan Avenue, 7th Floor 60611
location.locality_verbose: Park Hyatt Chicago, Gold Coast, Chicago

restaurant.timings: 2 PM to 12 Midnight (Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Sun), 2 PM to 1 AM (Fri-Sat)

review.review_text: Great upscale modern American Reataurant and bar. Great local Wisconsin cheese and all local grown farm raised meat and vegetables. I had great time talking to my server who shared with me all these information. Food is great. Great wine selection. Service was bit slow.

Ummmm .. Well not impressed at all especially with the service !! Took them for ever to get the menus and long time to serve the food .. Sashimi was not wow especially with the fish smell !! The burrata was good

Great Chicago rooftop. I love coming here simply because it is so relaxing. Great music selection for a Night out to enjoy drinks and be able to carry on a conversation. The drink selection is great and the appetizers and deserts are delicious.

restaurant.name: Chicago's Busy Burger
restaurant.timings: 10 AM to 12 Midnight (Mon-Sun)

review.review_text: I live right next to this place on Taylor and May and they have delicious burgers. I usually have the Stuffed Turkey Burger which is always cooked perfectly and tastes great with their busy sauce. The busy blob fries are amazing and a dish on their own.  The milkshakes are awesome. All of them. Made with organic ice cream and it's so thick it will not spill if held upside down. No joke, I've actually tried this.   If you drop in you are also eligible for a 15% discount on showing a valid student ID card or if you're in the police department.

Americans have been in love with burgers arguably since the first fast food chain (White Castle) launched in the 1920s, but the current infatuation is thought to have come to the forefront around 2011. There are several theories as to why the burger business amped up at that point in time, but many feel it was the result of a tough time in the economy – people wanted their beef quotient but at the time, couldn’t justify buying steak.

When we had the chance to check out the newly revamped Busy Burger, we didn't hesitate. Both of us have attended school at the University of Illinois - Circle Campus, so it was good to get back into the neighborhood. It's been a while. Parking was a breeze on a Saturday afternoon, surprisingly, but we didn't complain. Busy Burger touts itself as a healthier casual eatery, with never frozen, made by hand burgers, hand spun shakes and fresh cut fries. They use no preservatives, hormones, or antibiotics. Always a fan of this kind of philosophy.
In a town with a LOT of burger joints this place really stands out...love the mushroom burger and the mini burgers. Also the healthiest burgers in town for sure.
Good homemade burger, no unnecessary fluff. Watch out for spicy mayo if you aren't into spice.

restaurant.name: Ronny's Original Chicago Steak House

location.address: Atrium Mall at Thompson Center, 100 W. Randolph Street, Unit 122, Chicago 60601
location.locality: Atrium Mall at Thompson Center, Loop
location.locality_verbose: Atrium Mall at Thompson Center, Loop, Chicago

restaurant.timings: 7 AM to 10 PM (Mon-Sun)

review.review_text: Had the veggie omelet. It was huge, little heavy on the cheese. Came with huge pile of American fries, 2 huge pieces of Texas toast and 4 slices of watermelon for less ten dollars. Efficient and friendly.

Tucked away on W Randolph opposite an outlet of Cosi, this was a surprisingly good find.   The polish sausage breakfast served with toasted bread, 2eggs (any style), house potatoes and sliced watermelon is a sure winner in portion and taste!   The steak and pancakes combo satiates the meat and sweet craving. The steak strip could be better seasoned. But the pancakes steal the show. They're moist, soft and topped with the house maple syrup along with strawberries are an absolute delight!  Staff is polite and happy to serve.   Overall, a good bite that gives bang for the buck! Worth a visit!
Good for the price. I've only had the steak special. Nothing award winning, but it's pretty good for the price.

The first breakfast that I had in Chicago was at Ronny's. I was very impressed with the selection of food that was served here. They had ham, bacon, sausage, French toast, pancakes, eggs, potatoes, and of course steak. They also served fresh fruit with every meal. My girlfriend got two eggs, sausage and toast and was very pleased. It came with potatoes and a slice of watermelon. She saidthe toast was some of the best she ever had. I had the super breakfast which came with steak, eggs w/ cheese, potatoes, French toast w/ fresh strawberries and syrup, and a slice of watermelon. The portions were huge to say the least. The staff was very entertaining. They seemed to have been working there for a while and joked around with the customers a bit. I would recommend Ronny's if you are looking for an excellent, quick, and cheap breakfast!
